We know that sounds big, that‚Äôs because it is.

tweets.text: The Great Ouse has been the centre point of the current flooding. It can take days for the flood peak to travel to the sea. Our latest assessment of where the peaks will be and our preliminary view of records broken - live flood warnings here https://t.co/K5GUW3z87V #StormBella https://t.co/t6WVwlvmRo

#floodalert #bradfordonavon - CEV Paul with the 15:00hrs report. River level at 27.45m and rising with @EnvAgencySW mini barriers in place and team supplied with mince pies. Packhorse Bridge now flooded. Take care around flood water @DWFRSBoA @Trow_Fire_Stn @WiltshireWinter https://t.co/IaPI3QKIul

@RussellB1ggs @Hillfortian @WestNorfolkBC @EnvAgencyAnglia @N_Rivers_Trust @AnglianWater @The_WMA @WildTroutTrust @jamesowild Lovely river tales - we need such personal memories to avoid shifting baselines in our current efforts to reverse the decline of our #chalkstreams - will we ever experience such a healthy eel population again in the UK?  1/2

tweets.text:
#StormBella is creating heavy winds and rain across parts of England, increasing the risk of #flooding to some areas. 
 
Avoid coastal paths and stay safe from strong winds and high waves. 
 
Check your flood risk now:
https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/Kt3YXr5DV3
Simeon Street recreation Ground spring-Ryde @iwight @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency https://t.co/20n2aX2t7B

Following heavy rainfall yesterday and overnight, we have operated the Foss Barrier to help protect properties in York. In this video, our asset performance advisor Mark Fuller explains how it works #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/mMPzvj913L
May I ask... @EnvAgency When did you add SHARKS to the River Freshney, please? What was the rationale behind it? https://t.co/nrOiibjIBV

The River Aire burst its banks this morning; here's a short clip of what would usually be agricultural fields instead are now one very big lake.
@RSPBAireValley @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/5v292VGMXy
Some unedited footage (no sound) of the flooded Thames at Wittenham. https://t.co/f2mwRdPjKA

Absolutely, one of the ~450 pumping stations operated by #InternalDrainageBoards and @EnvAgency across the #Fens and wider Anglian region #lowlanddefenders https://t.co/PKP1ybtNZJ https://t.co/Gq1Nx4v3Rk
St Ives (Cambridgeshire) now ahead of the main river peak... you can see the peak created a couple of days ago by the lower catchment tributaries... @EnvAgencyAnglia https://t.co/F9pVvoNXOh

tweets.text:
We're working with the @EnvAgency through the festive period to help spread awareness about what to do in a #flooding event. 

Don't drive through flood water, turn around üôè  #StaySafe #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/FxJ92kyPG7

Right I‚Äôm home now and warming up. My thoughts with all those affected by flooding ... kudos to all my colleagues and partners working 24/7 to see this water thru the system...welcome to my new followers who will soon be very bored with obscure tweets about lower league football

tweets.text: We have reports of people in flood waters. Please do not walk, swim or drive through flood water. The rivers are flowing very quickly & you can‚Äôt tell where the edge of the path meet the river. There's many hidden dangers inc raised manhole covers & 30cm of water can move a car.
